reasoning: Breast cysts are common benign lesions. Prevalence among women of reproductive age estimated at 15-20% (15,000-20,000 per 100k women). Measured as prevalence, not incidence, since cysts are persistent features. Based on imaging and clinical epidemiology studies.
source: Santen RJ et al. (2010). Benign breast disease: endocrinology, breast biology, and management. J Endocr Rev. 31(5):595-622
